intro: Cryptocarya macdonaldii, commonly known as the MacDonald's cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are small, woody drupes that contain a single seed. Cryptocarya macdonaldii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
